descriptions:
**Title:** The Multisensory Mind: From Neural Mechanisms to Cognition

**Abstract:**

This grant proposal aims to investigate the neural mechanisms underlying multisensory integration (MI), a fundamental process by which sensory inputs from different modalities are merged into coherent percepts. The proposed research program will employ a multidisciplinary approach, utilizing human electroencephalography (EEG) data, source modeling of synchronized EEG activity, and magnetic resonance spectroscopy to examine neural and neurochemical markers of MI. Specifically, the objectives of this project are to: (1) examine the neural mechanisms of MI in healthy subjects and patients with schizophrenia, and (2) test a new hypothesis regarding synchronized neural populations during MI. The findings of this research will provide valuable insights into the understanding of MI and its applications in the treatment of conditions with impaired MI. Ultimately, this project aims to contribute significantly to the development of novel treatments for MI-related disorders, improving the quality of life for individuals affected by these conditions.
